definition: Count of individual loans within portfolio or facility grouping. Supports exposure granularity analysis.
Total effective interest rate including base rate and spread. Calculated pricing KPI that provides insight into total yield generation and supports risk-adjusted return analysis.
Date amendment became effective.
Status of amendment approval lifecycle.
Type of contractual amendment (e.g., covenant reset, maturity extension).
Snapshot date associated with the exposure record. Serves as timestamp reference for reporting accuracy.
Weighted average credit spread across exposures. Calculated as Σ(Spread × Exposure) / Total Exposure. Provides insight into portfolio pricing discipline and yield profile.
Weighted average remaining maturity across exposures. Calculated as Σ(Tenor × Exposure) / Total Exposure. Measures portfolio duration and refinancing risk exposure.
Reference benchmark interest rate applicable to the exposure (e.g., SOFR, Prime). Forms base component of total facility pricing.
Economic or regulatory capital assigned to exposure. Used in RAROC and capital efficiency evaluation.
Operating cash flow generated by borrower in millions USD. Primary indicator of repayment capacity.
Value of pledged collateral securing exposure in millions USD. Supports recovery analysis and secured lending assessment.
Total approved committed credit amount in millions USD representing contractual lending capacity.
Funding expense allocated to exposure in millions USD. Supports net profitability and risk-adjusted return calculations.
Exposure allocated to specific counterparty divided by total exposure. Concentration KPI measuring obligor dependency risk.
Unique system identifier assigned to the borrower or obligor. Used for exposure aggregation and risk consolidation.
Legal name of the borrowing entity. Used for reporting, documentation, and risk attribution.
Country of risk or booking location. Supports geographic concentration and sovereign risk analysis.
Unique identifier linking facility to governing credit agreement documentation.
Flag identifying exposures requiring heightened monitoring due to elevated credit risk. Governance control used for enhanced monitoring, reserve consideration, and management reporting.
Total exposure amount allocated across legal entities. Supports intra-group concentration transparency.
Most recent internal credit rating assigned at reporting date. Used for segmentation and exposure-weighted risk aggregation.
Number of days contractual payment obligation is past due. Used for staging classification and early credit deterioration monitoring.

Number of calendar days remaining until contractual maturity, calculated as (Maturity Date – Reporting Date). Derived tenor metric providing insight into rollover risk and portfolio duration concentration.
Number of calendar days payment remains unpaid beyond due date. Supports staging classification and regulatory default identification.
Calculated as Count of Delinquent Loans / Total Loans × 100. Portfolio stress KPI measuring prevalence of past-due exposures.
Indicator that exposure is past due. Used for credit monitoring, staging assessment, and early default identification.
Total outstanding exposure that is contractually past due in millions USD. Provides direct measurement of impaired balances and supports staging and loss forecasting analysis.

Derived indicator that the facility’s internal credit rating has worsened during the reporting period. Provides automated early deterioration signal supporting migration monitoring and risk escalation.

Cashflow divided by Total Debt Service. Calculated KPI measuring borrower’s ability to meet debt obligations from operating cash flow and providing insight into covenant compliance and credit resilience.
Date on which credit agreement or facility became legally effective.
Expected Loss divided by Exposure. Derived KPI measuring loss intensity relative to exposure size, enabling comparative risk ranking across facilities or counterparties.
Percentage of exposures within portfolio with approved pricing or policy exceptions. Derived governance KPI measuring policy discipline and risk culture strength.
PD × LGD × EAD. Calculated forward-looking credit loss estimate providing insight into economic loss expectations and supporting provisioning, capital allocation, and portfolio risk prioritization.
PD × LGD × EAD expressed in USD. Calculated forward-looking loss metric supporting provisioning, capital planning, and stress testing analytics.
Current drawn principal balance outstanding in millions USD. Represents funded credit risk at reporting date.
Committed but not yet drawn portion of credit exposure in millions USD. Reflects contingent funding risk.
Portion of committed exposure currently drawn. Used to assess funding deployment and credit capacity usage.
Current funded credit exposure outstanding in millions USD. Core balance sheet risk metric representing on-balance-sheet credit risk.
Maximum approved credit exposure authorized for the counterparty or facility in millions USD. Represents formal risk appetite allocation and governance control threshold.
Total expected exposure outstanding at time of default in millions USD. Regulatory capital modeling input that reflects forward-looking credit risk position.
Current external credit agency rating assigned to the obligor. Used for benchmarking, regulatory reporting, and external credit risk validation.
generic_formula: (Exposure rated BBB+ or above / Total exposure) × 100

definition: Unique identifier assigned to the lending facility within enterprise systems. Used to aggregate balances, risk metrics, pricing data, and contractual attributes at the facility level.
Descriptive name of the facility as documented in the credit agreement. Used for reporting clarity and operational reference.

metric_id: Facility Utilization Status (e.g., Sufficient, Approaching, Fully Utilized)
definition: Derived categorical classification of utilization level based on current drawn exposure relative to committed amount. Operational KPI providing early warning insight into limit pressure, liquidity usage, and potential capacity constraints.
Type of credit facility (e.g., Term Loan, Revolver, Letter of Credit). Enables product-level segmentation, risk concentration analysis, and performance benchmarking.
Fee percentage applied to committed or undrawn exposure. Calculated KPI supporting pricing adequacy and revenue optimization analysis.
Regulatory classification aligned to FR Y-14 / FR 2590 frameworks. Supports capital and stress testing submissions.
Indicator that facility agreement has undergone amendment. Portfolio KPI (% Facilities with Amendments) signals restructuring activity.
Indicator of exposure allocated across multiple legal entities. Portfolio KPI (% Cross-Entity Exposure) highlights structural complexity.
Unique identifier for the record or facility within system architecture.
Bank-assigned internal credit rating reflecting modeled risk assessment and expert judgment. Used for credit segmentation and capital allocation.

Month-over-month movement in internal credit rating expressed in notches. Derived metric that quantifies credit quality migration and provides early warning insight into deterioration or improvement trends, supporting proactive risk management and watchlist monitoring.
Indicator that facility or exposure is active and not closed or matured. Portfolio KPI (% Active Facilities) measures ongoing credit exposure footprint.
Boolean indicator that facility is syndicated. Portfolio KPI (% Syndicated Facilities) provides insight into risk distribution across lenders.
Highest-level organizational unit responsible for the exposure. Enables enterprise-wide aggregation and top-down risk reporting.
Mid-level portfolio classification used for risk segmentation, performance reporting, and concentration monitoring.
Lowest-level trading or management desk responsible for the exposure. Supports operational ownership and accountability tracking.
Legal entity booking or owning the exposure. Critical for regulatory capital and entity-level reporting.
Unique identifier assigned to legal entity in enterprise systems.
Exposure × LGD expressed in dollar terms. Derived loss severity metric estimating expected recovery-adjusted loss magnitude.
Status of credit limit (Active, Breached, Suspended). Used to monitor risk appetite breaches and exposure governance compliance.
Line of Business classification associated with exposure.
Level 1 Line of Business hierarchy. Enables top-level organizational risk aggregation.
Level 2 Line of Business hierarchy for intermediate aggregation and reporting.
Level 3 Line of Business hierarchy for detailed business segmentation.
Estimated percentage of exposure expected to be lost in event of default. Key risk severity parameter informing capital allocation and recovery expectations.
Exposure divided by Collateral Value. Calculated leverage KPI measuring collateral coverage strength and downside protection.
Contractual date on which the facility or loan is scheduled to mature. Used to assess duration exposure, refinancing risk, and liquidity planning.
generic_formula: Average (Maturity Date - Reporting Date) across portfolio

definition: Profit after all expenses in millions USD. Indicator of borrower profitability and financial sustainability.
Net Interest Income divided by earning assets. Calculated margin KPI assessing pricing effectiveness and lending profitability.
Allocated operating or servicing cost associated with exposure.
Date on which loan or facility was originally booked.
Current outstanding exposure balance in millions USD at reporting date.
Identifiers of counterparties participating in syndicated credit structures. Enables exposure attribution and concentration analysis.
Portfolio grouping assignment used for risk aggregation and reporting.
Indicator identifying exposures priced outside standard policy guidelines. Supports governance discipline and pricing compliance monitoring.
Pricing classification tier assigned to facility. Supports structured pricing strategy and yield segmentation.
generic_formula: Average spread for given pricing tier

definition: External rating from prior reporting period used to assess rating migration trends and compare directional credit movement over time.
Model-estimated probability of default within defined horizon. Core credit risk input supporting capital modeling, expected loss estimation, stress testing, and risk appetite alignment.
Product classification assigned to facility. Supports product-level segmentation and performance analysis.
Geographic region classification supporting portfolio segmentation and concentration monitoring.
Snapshot date of the dataset used for reporting and aggregation. Serves as the temporal reference point for all balances, risk metrics, and performance indicators.
Total income generated by the borrower or attributed to the facility in millions USD. Used to assess scale and repayment capacity.

metric_id: Risk Rating Status - External (e.g. Downgrade, Upgrade, Stable)
definition: Derived directional indicator reflecting movement in external credit agency rating between reporting periods. Supports benchmarking against market perception and helps validate internal risk assessment trends.

metric_id: Risk Rating Status - External Change - Steps (e.g. AAA to A = -2 steps)
definition: Numerical representation of external rating migration expressed in notch movement (positive or negative). Quantifies magnitude of credit change and enables portfolio-level migration analysis, stress testing sensitivity, and risk trend measurement.
generic_formula: Mean rating change steps (positive or negative)

metric_id: Risk Rating Status - Internal (e.g. Downgrade, Upgrade, Stable)
definition: Derived directional classification indicating whether the internal credit rating has upgraded, downgraded, or remained stable compared to the prior reporting period. Provides migration trend insight and serves as an early warning indicator of credit quality movement to support proactive risk management and escalation decisions.
Monetary value of applied risk mitigant. Portfolio KPI (Exposure Covered by Risk Mitigants %) measures capital relief and loss protection strength.
Sub-classification of risk mitigant type for granular risk segmentation.
Type of risk mitigation (e.g., collateral, guarantee). Used to assess recovery support mechanisms.
Net Income divided by Total Assets. Calculated efficiency KPI measuring asset productivity and overall financial performance.
Net Income divided by Equity. Calculated profitability KPI measuring return generated on shareholder capital and supporting performance benchmarking.
Industry sector classification enabling sector concentration risk assessment.
Credit spread over reference base rate charged on exposure, expressed as percentage. Represents risk premium embedded in pricing and supports yield analysis.
Time remaining to contractual maturity expressed in years. Supports duration and rollover risk analysis.
Total principal and interest obligations due within reporting period in millions USD. Used in repayment capacity and covenant analysis.
Exposure divided by Exposure Limit. Calculated KPI measuring the proportion of approved capacity currently drawn, providing insight into liquidity usage and limit pressure.
Current drawn amount divided by committed amount. Supports utilization and liquidity risk monitoring.
Weighted average loss given default across exposures. Derived severity KPI measuring expected recovery-adjusted portfolio loss sensitivity.
Weighted average probability of default across exposures. Derived portfolio-level risk intensity KPI supporting concentration and stress scenario analysis.
Comma-separated list of facility IDs impacted by in-scope credit events for a given counterparty and time period.
Number of distinct facilities impacted by in-scope credit events. Represents relationship size of impacted exposures.
Total gross exposure (USD) across facilities linked to in-scope credit events. Uses facility_exposure_snapshot for current exposure.
Limit breach tier: No Breach / Warning / Breach based on utilization vs threshold bands from limit_threshold.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN utilization_pct < inner_threshold_pct THEN 'No Breach' WHEN utilization_pct < outer_threshold_pct THEN 'Warning' ELSE 'Breach' END

definition: Total approved limit amount (USD) across active, non-waived limits.
Total utilized exposure (USD) against active limits.
Available headroom: limit minus utilized. Positive = capacity remaining.
Limit utilization percentage.
Limit breach status as of prior month-end. For month-over-month comparison.
generic_formula: tier logic applied to prior month-end snapshot

definition: Most recent timestamp of limit utilization update.
Total gross exposure (USD) under in-scope stress test scenarios.
Total expected loss (USD) under stress scenarios.
Capital impact as % of Tier 1 capital. Pre-calculated in stress_test_result by risk engine.
Flag: is the counterparty a parent entity in the hierarchy.
Probability of default. Single counterparty: obligor-level pd_annual. Aggregated views: exposure-weighted PD per Basel IRB standard (Σ PD×EAD / Σ EAD).
generic_formula: Counterparty-level: pd_annual; Aggregated: SUM(pd_estimate * EAD) / SUM(EAD)

definition: Loss given default. Single counterparty: unsecured LGD. Aggregated: exposure-weighted per Basel IRB.
generic_formula: Counterparty-level: lgd_unsecured; Aggregated: SUM(lgd_estimate * EAD) / SUM(EAD)

definition: Total approved credit limit for a specific counterparty.
Flag: does this counterparty have exposure booked across multiple legal entities. MODEL GAP: recommend adding cross_entity_flag to facility_exposure_snapshot.
generic_formula: cross_entity_flag (proposed new field) OR CASE WHEN COUNT(DISTINCT legal_entity_id) > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

definition: Total exposure for counterparties with cross-entity presence. Filtered to cross_entity_flag = Y once added.
Limit utilization percentage at counterparty level.
Month-over-month change in gross exposure at counterparty level.
Quarter-over-quarter change in gross exposure at counterparty level.
Year-over-year change in gross exposure at counterparty level.
Numeric change in internal rating. Positive = downgrade (higher notch = worse).
Average credit spread (%) across facilities. Converted from bps.
Average base/reference rate (%) across facilities.
All-in rate: base + spread. Also pre-calculated as all_in_rate_pct on facility_master.
generic_formula: AVG(base_rate_pct + spread_bps/100) OR all_in_rate_pct from facility_master

definition: PD from risk metric observation. Alternative to C015 — this reads the pre-calculated value from the metrics store.
generic_formula: metric_value from financial_metric_observation WHERE metric_code = PD

definition: LGD from risk metric observation.
generic_formula: metric_value from financial_metric_observation WHERE metric_code = LGD

definition: Expected loss: PD × LGD × EAD. Pre-calculated in financial_metric_observation.
Total delinquent amount (principal + interest overdue) at counterparty level.
Maximum days past due across all facilities for a counterparty.
Return on equity proxy. APPROXIMATION: uses profitability snapshot income/equity. MODEL GAP: true ROE needs provision_for_credit_losses, non_interest_expense, tax on facility_profitability_snapshot.
Return on assets proxy. Same MODEL GAP as ROE.
Net interest margin. This metric uses existing fields and does not require MODEL GAP additions.
Average tenor (years) across active facilities.
Loan-to-value: exposure / collateral valuation.
Internal rating direction: Downgrade / Upgrade / Stable.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN rating_value > prior_rating_value THEN 'Downgrade' WHEN < THEN 'Upgrade' ELSE 'Stable' END

definition: External rating direction: Downgrade / Upgrade / Stable.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN rating_value > prior THEN 'Downgrade' WHEN < THEN 'Upgrade' ELSE 'Stable' END

definition: External rating change in notch steps (negative = downgrade, e.g. AAA → A = -2).
Total risk mitigant value allocated to a facility.
Dominant risk mitigant type by value (Cash, Sovereign Debt, Guarantees, etc.).
Dominant mitigant group (M1 = Eligible Collateral, M2 = Other CRM) by value.
List of counterparty IDs participating in a syndicated facility.
Syndication flag: >1 participating counterparty.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN COUNT(DISTINCT counterparty_id) > 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

definition: Outstanding gross exposure for the facility. Direct read from facility_exposure_snapshot.
Active facility flag.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN facility_status = 'Active' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

definition: Flag: facility has an active/pending amendment.
generic_formula: CASE WHEN EXISTS amendment_event THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

definition: Credit spread (%) for the facility.
Base/reference rate (%) for the facility.
Fee rate as % of average earning assets.
Tenor in years from origination to maturity.
Days remaining until facility maturity.
Count of loan positions under a facility.
Utilized exposure at facility level from limit contribution.
Number of active portfolios in the department/LoB.
Number of desks in the department/LoB.
Total approved exposure limit for the department/LoB.
Utilization % at portfolio level.
Worst-case limit status across all counterparties in the portfolio.
generic_formula: Worst-case tier across counterparties in portfolio

definition: Month-over-month exposure change at portfolio level.
Quarter-over-quarter exposure change at portfolio level.
Year-over-year exposure change at portfolio level.
Month-over-month spread change.
Quarter-over-quarter spread change.
Year-over-year spread change.
Month-over-month base rate change.
Quarter-over-quarter base rate change.
Year-over-year base rate change.
Delinquency rate: delinquent exposure / total exposure.
MoM change in count of internal rating downgrades.

RWA density: risk-weighted assets / exposure. RWA is pre-calculated by risk engine and stored in financial_metric_observation (metric_code = RWA). MODEL GAP: for position-level drill-down, add risk_weight_pct and rwa_amount_usd to L2.position.
RWA density for prior month-end.
Average spread at desk level for prior month.
Average spread at desk level for prior quarter.
Average spread at desk level for prior year.
Average base rate at desk level for prior month.
Average base rate at desk level for prior quarter.
Average base rate at desk level for prior year.
Count of distinct collateral assets at desk level.
Prior month collateral asset count at desk level.
Prior month net income proxy at desk level.
Total capital requirement at desk level.
Weighted average spread from facility pricing and exposure, calculated across hierarchy levels.
Exposure-weighted DSCR across hierarchy levels.
Total outstanding exposure aggregated at each hierarchy level.
Total utilized/drawn exposure aggregated at each hierarchy level.
Exposure-weighted LTV across hierarchy levels.
Exposure-weighted PD across hierarchy levels.
Exposure-weighted LGD across hierarchy levels.
Expected loss aggregated across hierarchy levels.
